meanings.definition: To cook (food) for too long, resulting in it being burnt or dried out.
meanings.sent1: I always overcook my pasta, making it too mushy to eat.
meanings.sent2: She tends to overcook the chicken, making it tough and tasteless.
meanings.sent3: Don't overcook the popcorn unless you want it to resemble charcoal!
meanings.sent4: Her attempt to bake the cake perfectly led her to overcook it into a brick.
meanings.sent5: The chef's mistake was to overcook the steak until it resembled shoe leather.

meanings.sent1: If you overcook the vegetables, they will lose all their nutrients.
meanings.sent2: He tends to overcook the rice, making it sticky and unappetizing.
meanings.sent3: She managed to overcook the soup until it turned into a thick paste.
meanings.sent4: The sun seemed to overcook the earth, leaving it parched and cracked.
meanings.sent5: The baker's mistake was to overcook the cookies, turning them into hard discs.
